// Mode to be applied while running this testcase collection
//   "analysis" -> human does detailed analysis of response bodies etc.
//   "testing" -> automated approval based on binary result
//   "debugging" -> support for programming the testcase collection
// Level of detail of the logging; find more info in pre-request script on the collection's level
// list of addresses of applications, controllers etc.
// serverName : key attribute for identifying the servers
// dummyUri : http address that shall be addressed by bare processing Requests
// server : part of the URI that is comprised from protocol, IP address and TCP port
// pathToControlConstruct : part of the URI that is identical for all Requests that are addressing into the device's data tree
// authorizationCode : authentication that has to be sent in case of BasicAuth protection (e.g. OpenDaylight NBI)
// operationKey : ApiKey that has to be sent in case of addressing a MW SDN application (e.g. MicroWaveDeviceInventory)
// userName : user header to be sent in case of addressing a MW SDN application
// originator : originator header to be sent in case of addressing a MW SDN application
// xCorrelator : x-correlator header to be sent in case of addressing a MW SDN application
// traceIndicator : trace-indicator header to be sent in case of addressing a MW SDN application
// customerJourney : customer-journey header to be sent in case of addressing a MW SDN application
// list of inputs to individual test case collections
// serverToBeApplied : server that shall be addressed in the respective request/test case
// mountName : mountName of the device that is to be validated
// uuid of the object that is to be validated
// localId of the object that is to be validated
// linkId : linkName of the link that is to be validated
// linkPort : id of the linkPort that is to be validated

item.description:
**Remarks for** _**/v1/provide-cache-quality-statistics**_**:**

The service has an optional group-by deviceType, which can be handed over in the requestBody.

If there are not enough raw sample records, no output will be generated, but an error response. However if there are enough sample records, the following output will be created depending on the requestBody:

- (a) without requestBody:
    
    - there shall just be a single array element under _cache-quality-statistics_
        
    - with device-type="all"
        
- (b) with valid group-by requstBody:
    
    - there shall be an array element for each vendor found in the raw statistics data
        
    - each array element will have a different device-type value
        
    - there will be no array element with device-type = "all"
        

The tests depend on the option:

- for (a) the response data must (1) match the reference schema, where the device-type is defined as an enum ("all") and (2) not have more than a single array element
    
- for (b) the response data must just match the reference schema, there shall be no device-type="all" array element; the number of array elements can vary depending on the number of vendors found in the raw data
    

This testcase collection tests both cases with:

- option a: datafile collectionName = completeness.dataprovider
    
- option b: datafile collectionName = completeness.dataprovider.qs
    

Note that the schema definition in the OAS does not explicitly define whether the device-type needs to be "all" or not "all". This is just expressed in the OAS descriptions! Therefore, the reference schemas provided in the testcases do not exactly match the schemas from the OAS!
